question: Match the following:
columnA: Hydrocolloids from brown and red algae
columnB: Increase the level of dissolved oxygen in their immediate environment
Used as food
Algin and carrageen
At least a half carried out by algae
Form the basis of the food cycles of all aquatic animals

answer.Carbon dioxide fixation on earth: At least a half carried out by algae
answer.Photosynthetic algae: Increase the level of dissolved oxygen in their immediate environment
answer.Primary producers of energy-rich compoun: Form the basis of the food cycles of all aquatic animals

question: Match the following:
columnA: Used to grow microbes and in preparations of ice-creams and jellies
columnB: Chlorophyceae, Phaeophyceae and Rhodophyceae
A unicellular alga rich in proteins
Used as food supplement even by space travellers
Commercial product obtained from Gelidium and Gracilaria
Agar

answer.Agar: Commercial product obtained from Gelidium and Gracilaria
answer.Chlorella: A unicellular alga rich in proteins
answer.Gelidium and Gracilaria: Used to grow microbes and in preparations of ice-creams and jellies

question: Match the following:
columnB: Chlorophyll a and b
Contain protein besides starch
Unicellular, colonial or filamentous
An inner layer of cellulose and an outer layer of pectose
Oil droplets

answer.Green algae cell wall: An inner layer of cellulose and an outer layer of pectose

question: Match the following:
columnB: Chlamydomonas, Volvox, Ulothrix, Spirogyra and Chara
Discoid, plate-like, reticulate, cup-shaped, spiral or ribbon-shaped
Considerable variation in the type and formation of sex cells
By flagellated zoospores produced in zoosporangia
By fragmentation

answer.Chloroplast shapes in green algae: Discoid, plate-like, reticulate, cup-shaped, spiral or ribbon-shaped
answer.Asexual reproduction in green algae: By flagellated zoospores produced in zoosporangia
answer.Sexual reproduction in green algae: Considerable variation in the type and formation of sex cells
answer.Common green algae: Chlamydomonas, Volvox, Ulothrix, Spirogyra and Chara

question: Match the following:
columnB: Chlorophyll a, c, carotenoids and xanthophylls
Primarily in marine habitats
Simple branched, filamentous forms
Profusely branched forms which may reach a height of 100 metres
Show great variation

answer.Kelps: Profusely branched forms which may reach a height of 100 metres
answer.Pigments in brown algae: Chlorophyll a, c, carotenoids and xanthophylls
